metadata.title: CVE-2014-0050 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
MultipartStream.java in Apache Commons FileUpload before 1.3.1, as used inApache Tomcat, JBoss Web, and other products, allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (infinite loop and CPU consumption) via a craftedContent-Type header that bypasses a loop's intended exit conditions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0050` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1
No subscription required

libcommons-fileupload-java - 1.3.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1').
libcommons-fileupload-java package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.1-1').
